doc.ContractDescription: IGF::CT,CL::IGF ENGINEERING AND TECHNOLOGY ACQUISITION SUPPORT SERVICES (ETASS II)
8503063908!NUT,COUPLING,COMPRE

IGF::OT::IGF THIS PROGRAM ADDRESSES THE NEED TO MONITOR SURFACE RECESSION, TEMPERATURE, AND THROUGH-THICKNESS PROPERTIES OF THERMAL PROTECTION SYSTEM (TPS) MATERIALS. THESE TPS MATERIALS HAVE UNIQUE PROPERTIES FOR SHEDDING THE HEAT GENERATED UNDER REENTRY CONDITIONS TO PROTECT THE INTEGRITY OF THE SPACECRAFT. HOWEVER, EVER-INCREASING MISSION DEMANDS REQUIRE IMPROVED PERFORMANCE AND A BETTER UNDERSTANDING FOR MODERN HEAT SHIELD STRUCTURES. THIS CAN BE ACCOMPLISHED WITH A NONINVASIVE, NONDESTRUCTIVE METHOD THAT USES PROJECTED SENSING FIELDS THROUGH THE THICKNESS OF THE TPS MATERIAL. NOVEL EDDY CURRENT METHODS ARE PROPOSED THAT INCORPORATE INNOVATIVE SENSOR ARRAY CONSTRUCTS, PHYSICS-BASED MODELS, AND MULTIVARIATE INVERSE METHODS TO NONDESTRUCTIVELY ASSESS CARBON-BASED TPS MATERIALS SUCH AS PHENOLIC IMPREGNATED CARBON ABLATOR (PICA). THE SENSORS CAN BE MOUNTED BEHIND THE TPS MATERIAL OR EMBEDDED WITHIN THE TPS WITH SENSING MAGNETIC FIELDS THAT ARE PROJECTED THROUGH THE MATERIAL.
doc.MajorAgency: THROUGH-THICKNESS HEALTH MONITORING OF THERMAL PRO

doc.ContractDescription: GLOBAL DUST STORMS ARE A UNIQUELY MARTIAN ATMOSPHERIC PHENOMENON. THEIR SEEMINGLY RANDOM OCCURRENCES IN MARTIAN SOUTHERN SPRING AND SUMMER HAVE THUS FAR ELUDED PREDICTION AND THEORETICAL UNDERSTANDING. ATTEMPTS TO SIMULATE SUCH STORMS WITH ATMOSPHERIC MODELS HAVE RESULTED IN MIXED SUCCESS. IN ADDITION TO GLOBAL STORMS, DUST STORMS AT SUCCESSIVELY SMALLER SCALES OCCUR AT INCREASING FREQUENCIES WITH REGIONAL STORMS PREFERENTIALLY DEVELOPING IN CERTAIN SEASONS AND LOCATIONS AND LOCAL STORMS OCCURRING NEARLY DAILY OVER THE PLANET. THE CLOSURE OF THE DUST CYCLE REFERS TO THE SPATIAL AND TEMPORAL SCALE OVER WHICH THE NET FLUX (DEFLATION VS. DEPOSITION) OF DUST IS BALANCED. THE LENGTH OF TIME OVER WHICH THE MARTIAN DUST CYCLE IS CLOSED REMAINS UNKNOWN UNDERSTANDING THE VARIABILITY OF ACTIVE DUST LIFTING SOURCES WILL OBSERVATIONALLY CORROBORATE THE PREDICTIONS MADE BY GENERAL CIRCULATION MODELS (GCMS), AND CONSTRAIN THE PROPORTIONAL ROLE DUST STORMS PLAY IN CLOSING THE DUST CYCLE. THE PROPOSED RESEARCH WILL FOCUS ON THE SURFACE SOURCES OF DUST STORMS ON MARS. WE PROPOSE TO ANALYZE OBSERVATIONS FROM THE MARS GLOBAL SURVEYOR (MGS) AND MARS RECONNAISSANCE ORBITER (MRO) AND UTILIZE SPECIFIC DIRECTED NUMERICAL EXPERIMENTS WITH THE MARSWRF GCM TO ADDRESS THE FOLLOWING SCIENCE QUESTIONS: 1. WHERE AND WHAT ARE THE SOURCES OF DUST STORMS ON MARS? 2. WHAT IS THE CORRELATION OF DUST SOURCES TO SURFACE PROPERTIES? 3. WHAT IS THE THREE-DIMENSIONAL STRUCTURE OF DUST IN AND AROUND DUST STORMS? 4. WHAT IS THE IMPACT OF DUST STORMS ON FUTURE STORM GENERATION? THESE QUESTIONS WILL BE ADDRESSED IN FOUR STEPS. FIRST, WE WILL EXAMINE MARS DAILY GLOBAL MAPS (MDGMS), PRODUCED WITH WIDE-ANGLE IMAGES FROM THE MGS/MARS ORBITAL CAMERA (MOC) AND FROM THE MRO/MARS COLOR IMAGER (MARCI), FOR LOCATIONS OF ACTIVE DUST LIFTING AND CONSTRUCT A DATABASE OF DUST LIFTING LOCATIONS OVER 5 MARS YEARS (MYS). NEXT, WE WILL CORRELATE THESE DUST LIFTING LOCATIONS TO SURFACE PROPERTIES SUCH AS THERMAL INERTIA, MINERALOGY, TOPOGRAPHY AND ALBEDO USING PUBLICALLY-AVAILABLE DATA. THIRDLY, WE WILL STUDY THE THREE-DIMENSIONAL SPATIAL STRUCTURE OF DUST MIXING RATIO WITHIN DUST STORMS ASSOCIATED WITH THE PREVIOUSLY CONSTRUCTED DATABASE IDENTIFIED BY MRO/MARCI WITH THE MRO/MARS CLIMATE SOUNDER (MCS). FINALLY, USING THE MARSWRF GCM, WE WILL SIMULATE LOCAL AND REGIONAL SCALE DUST STORMS LIKE THOSE OBSERVED WITH MARCI AT HIGH HORIZONTAL RESOLUTION AND EXAMINE THE IMPACT SUCH A STORM HAS ON THE METEOROLOGICAL PARAMETERS (E.G., SURFACE WIND STRESS) THAT MAY INFLUENCE FUTURE DUST STORMS AT VARIOUS SCALES. IN ADDITION TO PUBLICATION OF THE RESULTS OF OUR RESEARCH, WE ALSO INTEND TO PROVIDE A DATABASE OF DUST LIFTING SOURCE REGIONS FOR BOTH THE MGS/MOC AND THE MRO/MARCI MISSIONS AND HOST IT ON THE INTERNET. BESIDES THE DUST CYCLE, WE BELIEVE SUCH A DATABASE WILL ALSO BE QUITE USEFUL FOR OTHER APPLICATIONS SUCH AS DATA ASSIMILATION. THIS PROPOSAL CONTRIBUTES TO THE ULTIMATE GOAL TO UNDERSTAND THE MECHANISMS OF THE DEVELOPMENT OF MARTIAN GLOBAL DUST STORMS, WHICH ARE STILL UNKNOWN AT THIS TIME AND UNABLE TO BE PREDICTED BY CURRENT GCMS (MEPAG, 2008). IT WILL HELP CONSTRAIN DUST CYCLE CLOSURE USING CURRENTLY AVAILABLE DATASETS. THIS ANALYSIS WILL ALSO AID SIGNIFICANTLY IN CHARACTERIZING THE DYNAMICS OF ATMOSPHERIC REGIONS OVER DAILY, SEASONAL, AND INTER-ANNUAL TIME SCALES, A STATED PRIORITY OF THE MEPAG SCIENCE GOALS, OBJECTIVES, INVESTIGATIONS, AND PRIORITIES: 2008 IN GOAL II, OBJECTIVE A. THIS WORK DIRECTLY RESPONDS TO IMPORTANT MARS SCIENCE QUESTIONS SPECIFIED IN VISIONS AND VOYAGES FOR PLANETARY SCIENCE IN THE DECADE 2013-2022 (NATIONAL RESEARCH COUNCIL, 2011) REGARDING PROCESSES THAT CONTROL MODERN CLIMATIC VARIABILITY AND THE PROCESSES BEHIND GLOBAL DUST STORMS.

FUNDING TO SUPPORT SOFTWARE CAPABILITY AND ENGINEERING ANALYSIS IGF::OT::IGF

GROUND-BASED NETWORKS OF CO-LOCATED SPACE GEODETIC TECHNIQUES (VLBI, SLR, GNSS, AND DORIS) ARE THE BASIS FOR THE DEVELOPMENT AND MAINTENANCE OF THE INTERNATIONAL TERRESTRIAL REFERENCE FRAME (ITRF), WHICH IS OUR METRIC OF REFERENCE FOR MEASUREMENTS RELEVANT FOR BETTER UNDERSTANDING OF GLOBAL CHANGE. THESE NETWORKS PROVIDE MEASUREMENTS OF STATIC AND TIME-VARYING COMPONENTS OF THE EARTH S GRAVITY FIELD; PRECISION ORBIT DETERMINATION, CALIBRATION, AND VALIDATION FOR ACTIVE SATELLITES SYSTEMS FOR ALTIMETRY (E.G. ALTIMETRY), AND TIME TRANSFER AND DETERMINATION OF FUNDAMENTAL CONSTANTS. DATA FROM THESE NETWORKS PROVIDE EARTH ORIENTATION PARAMETERS, TIME HISTORY OF GROUND STATION POSITIONS AND BASELINE LENGTH, STRAIN MODELS, MEAN SEA LEVEL AND OCEAN SURFACE TOPOGRAPHY, MARINE TIDE MODELS, ATMOSPHERIC AND IONOSPHERE PARAMETERS.

doc.ContractDescription: THIS PROJECT PROPOSES A COLLABORATION BETWEEN THE MASSACHUSETTS INSTITUTE OF TECHNOLOGY AND NASA TO DEVELOP NEW TECHNOLOGIES TO DEMONSTRATE LARGE AREA SENSING STRUCTURES MADE OF TWO-DIMENSIONAL (2D) MATERIALS SUCH AS GRAPHENE AND TRANSITION METAL DICHALCOGENIDES. FOR THIS, GRAPHENE, MOLIBDENUM DISULFIDE (M0S2) AND OTHER 2D MATERIALS WILL BE GROWN BY CHEMICAL VAPOR DEPOSITION AND INTEGRATED ON A VARIETY OF SUBSTRATES SUCH AS PEN AND KAPTON. THESE MATERIALS WILL BE COMBINED WITH 3D PRINTING AND ELECTRO-SPRAYING FABRICATION TECHNOLOGIES TO DEMONSTRATE A FLEXIBLE "SMART-SKIN" LAYER THAT INTEGRATES SENSORS, CONTROL ELECTRONICS, ENERGY STORAGE AND HARVESTING DEVICES. IT IS EXPECTED THAT THE PROPOSED PROJECT WILL ENABLE THE BASIC BUILDING BLOCKS FOR A WIDE VARIETY OF APPLICATIONS OF HIGH RELEVANCE TO NASA, SUCH AS FLEXIBLE COATINGS TO MONITOR THE STRUCTURAL INTEGRITY OF SPACECRAFTS AND SMART TEXTILES FOR THE NEXT GENERATION OF SPACESUITS. IN ADDITION, TO FURTHER MAXIMIZE THE IMPACT OF THE PROPOSED RESEARCH, THE PROGRAM WILL INTERACT CLOSELY WITH NASA AND THE IVIIT CENTER FOR GRAPHENE DEVICES AND 2D-SYSTEMS, WHICH IS FOCUSED ON FOSTERING THE TECHNOLOGY TRANSFER FROM THE UNIVERSITY RESEARCH LAB TO INDUSTRY. FINALLY, BY PROVIDING A MULTIDISCIPLINARY TRAINING ENVIRONMENT, THIS PROJECT AIMS TO BECOME A VITAL SOURCE OF TALENT FOR ESTABLISHING THE NATIONAL INFRASTMCTURE NEEDED TO ENABLE LOW-COST AND HIGHLY DISTRIBUTED SENSING NETWORKS BASED ON 2D MATERIALS.
doc.MajorAgency: UBIQUITOUS 2-DIMENSIONAL SMART SENSING (UDS2) INIT

doc.ContractDescription: IGF::CL,CT::IGF PROCUREMENT OF PROFESSIONAL ACQUISITION SUPPORT SERVICES

THIS IS A PROPOSAL FOR A COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT BETWEEN NASA GODDARD SPACE FLIGHT CENTER (GSFC) AND THE SMITHSONIAN ASTROPHYSICAL OBSERVATORY (SAO) OF CAMBRIDGE, MASSACHUSETTS. THE AGREEMENT WILL CONTINUE AND EXPAND THE EXTREMELY PRODUCTIVE TEAMING RELATIONSHIP THAT HAS BEEN DIRECTED TOWARDS THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE CONSTELLATION X-RAY OBSERVATORY (RECAST AS THE INTERNATIONAL X-RAY OBSERVATORY AND THEN AXSIO) OVER THE PAST FIFTEEN YEARS. THE PROPOSED AGREEMENT WHEN PUT IN PLACE WILL ENSURE THAT THE UNIQUE EXPERTISE, EXPERTISE, AND INSIGHT OF THE SAO TEAM THAT HAS SUPPORTED CONSTELLATION-X/IXO/AXSIO WILL BE MADE AVAILABLE TO NASA AS IT FORMULATES PLANS FOR MEETING THE NEW WORLDS NEW HORIZON (NWNH) DECADAL X-RAY SCIENCE PRIORITIES IN TIME FOR THE MID DECADAL REVIEW.

doc.ContractDescription: THE GOAL OF THIS WORK IS TO DERIVE H3+ DENSITIES AND TEMPERATURES IN SATURN S LOW-LATITUDE IONOSPHERE USING NEW GROUND-BASED HIGH- RESOLUTION MID-IR OBSERVATIONS, AND CONSEQUENTLY TO SIGNIFICANTLY IMPROVE UNDERSTANDING OF A NUMBER OF RELATED TOPICS, INCLUDING: RING-ATMOSPHERE COUPLING, UNEXPLAINED IONOSPHERIC ELECTRON DENSITIES, GLOBAL THERMOSPHERIC TEMPERATURES, AND RING/ATMOSPHERIC EVOLUTION. MOTIVATION: RECENTLY, EMISSION FROM H3+, A MAJOR ION IN GIANT PLANET IONOSPHERES, WAS OBSERVED AT MID- AND LOW-LATITUDES AT SATURN FOR THE FIRST TIME. THOSE H3+ EMISSIONS REVEALED SIGNIFICANT LATITUDINAL STRUCTURE, WITH LOCAL EXTREMA IN ONE HEMISPHERE BEING MIRRORED AT MAGNETICALLY CONJUGATE LATITUDES IN THE OPPOSITE HEMISPHERE. EVEN MORE STRIKING, THOSE MINIMA AND MAXIMA MAPPED TO REGIONS OF INCREASED OR DECREASED DENSITY IN SATURN S RINGS, IMPLYING A DIRECT RING-ATMOSPHERE CONNECTION IN WHICH CHARGED WATER GROUP PARTICLES FROM THE RINGS ARE GUIDED BY MAGNETIC FIELD LINES AS THEY RAIN DOWN UPON THE ATMOSPHERE, QUENCHING SATURN S IONOSPHERE. THERE ARE A NUMBER OF RELATED, POORLY UNDERSTOOD PROCESSES IN SATURN S UPPER ATMOSPHERE. FOR EXAMPLE: (A) NEUTRAL TEMPERATURES ARE OBSERVED TO BE MUCH WARMER THAN CAN BE EXPLAINED BY MODELS; (B) OBSERVED IONOSPHERIC ELECTRON DENSITIES ARE HIGHLY VARIABLE AND DEMONSTRATE A COUNTER-INTUITIVE LATITUDINAL BEHAVIOR; (C) A SIGNIFICANT SUPPLY OF EXTERNAL WATER HAS BEEN INFERRED FROM PREVIOUS OBSERVATIONS OF SATURN S ATMOSPHERE, YET THE SOURCE, SOURCE RATE AND VARIABILITY REMAIN LARGELY UNCONSTRAINED. UNFORTUNATELY, THE OBSERVATIONS THAT FACILITATED THE DISCOVERY OF SATURN S RING RAIN LACKED SUFFICIENT SIGNAL-TO-NOISE TO DERIVE THE FUNDAMENTAL H3+ PARAMETERS SUCH AS TEMPERATURE AND DENSITY NECESSARY TO ADDRESS THE TOPICS LISTED ABOVE. A NEW OBSERVATIONAL PROGRAM WOULD ADDRESS THAT INSUFFICIENCY WITH INCREASED INTEGRATION, AND WOULD ALSO ALLOW FOR INVESTIGATIONS OF TEMPORAL AND SPATIAL VARIABILITY. METHODOLOGY: WE PROPOSE TO OBTAIN NEW OBSERVATIONS SATURN AT 4 MICRON USING THE NIRSPEC INSTRUMENT ON THE 10-M W.M. KECK II TELESCOPE, SPANNING 2014-2016. WITH THE INCREASED SIGNAL-TO-NOISE ACHIEVED THROUGH LONGER INTEGRATION PERIODS, GLOBAL MAPS OF H3+ COLUMN DENSITY AND TEMPERATURE WILL BE DERIVED, AND THEIR EVOLUTION IN TIME INVESTIGATED. BASED ON COMPARISONS WITH STATE-OF-THE-ART MODELING OF SATURN S IONOSPHERE, WE WILL BE ABLE TO ESTIMATE BOTH LOCAL AND GLOBAL WATER ION INFLUX RATES FROM SATURN S RINGS, AND THEREFORE IMPROVE ESTIMATES OF THE AGE AND LIFETIME OF SATURN S RINGS AS WELL AS INVESTIGATE THE RESULTING ALTERATIONS IN THE PHYSICAL STATE OF THE UPPER ATMOSPHERE.
doc.MajorAgency: THE DOMINANCE OF SATURN'S ATMOSPHERE BY RING-RAIN:
doc.MajorFundingAgency: THE DOMINANCE OF SATURN'S ATMOSPHERE BY RING-RAIN:

doc.ContractDescription: IGF::CL,CT::IGF PROCUREMENT OF PROFESSIONAL ACQUISITION SUPPORT SERVICES
IGF::OT::IGF REPAIR FOR THE 415 SCMS/GUMAA MILSTAR PROGRAM

UNCERTAINTIES IN THE LABORATORY-DETERMINED ULTRAVIOLET CROSS SECTIONS AND EQUILIBRIUM CONSTANT OF CLOOCL CURRENTLY LIMIT THE ACCURACY OF ATMOSPHERIC MODELS OF STRATOSPHERIC OZONE LOSSES AND FUTURE OZONE LEVELS. INDEED, A STUDY BY KAWA ET AL. [2009] FOUND THAT UNCERTAINTIES IN THE PHOTOLYSIS RATE OF CLOOCL INTRODUCE THE LARGEST UNCERTAINTIES IN MODELING STRATOSPHERIC OZONE LOSS. RECENT MOLECULAR BEAM STUDIES [CHEN ET AL., 2009; LIEN ET AL., 2009] HAVE PRODUCED HIGHER ABSORPTION CROSS SECTIONS THAN ANY LAB STUDY TO DATE AND GENERALLY DISAGREE WITH OTHER CROSS SECTION MEASUREMENTS. THIS IS OF PARTICULAR INTEREST NEAR THE PEAK OF THE CLOOCL ABSORPTION. IF THE LIEN ET AL. [2009] CROSS SECTION VALUE AT 248 NM IS CORRECT, ALL PAST ABSORPTION CROSS SECTION MEASUREMENTS AT THE PEAK ARE THEREFORE IN ERROR, MOST BY ~40%, AND THE ENTIRE WAVELENGTH RANGE OF PREVIOUSLY PUBLISHED SPECTRA MUST BE RESCALED BY A COMMENSURATE AMOUNT. THE JPL PANEL ITSELF [SANDER ET AL., 2011] HAS CALLED FOR FURTHER STUDIES OF THE PEAK CROSS SECTION AS WELL AS THE SPECTRUM AT WAVELENGTHS GREATER THAN 300 NM. ADDITIONALLY, THE EQUILIBRIUM CONSTANT OF THE DIMERIZATION REACTION OF CLO MERITS FURTHER STUDY, AS THERE ARE IMPORTANT DISCREPANCIES BETWEEN IN SITU MEASUREMENTS AND LAB-BASED MODELS, AND THE JPL-RECOMMENDED EQUILIBRIUM CONSTANT INCLUDES HIGH ERROR BARS AT ATMOSPHERICALLY RELEVANT TEMPERATURES (~75% AT 200 K). IN THIS PROJECT, WE WILL PERFORM TWO NEW LABORATORY STUDIES OF CLOOCL OVER A RANGE OF CONDITIONS RELEVANT TO THE ATMOSPHERE WITH THE PURPOSE OF SIGNIFICANTLY REDUCING THE UNCERTAINTY IN THE UV CROSS SECTIONS AND EQUILIBRIUM CONSTANT. IN THE UV ABSORPTION CROSS SECTION STUDY, WE WILL EMPLOY A NEW TWO-ABSORPTION-CELL TECHNIQUE. HIGHLY ACCURATE CROSS SECTIONS, ESPECIALLY AROUND THE PEAK CLOOCL ABSORPTION, ARE OBTAINED BY RELATING THE CLOOCL ABSORPTION FROM ONE CELL TO THE CLOOCL CONCENTRATION, DETERMINED FROM CLO OBSERVATIONS OF DISSOCIATED CLOOCL, IN THE OTHER CELL. THE TWO ABSORPTION CELLS ARE POSITIONED IN SERIES WITH THE FIRST HELD AT COLD TEMPERATURES AND THE SECOND AT ROOM TEMPERATURE OR SLIGHTLY ABOVE WITH A HEATING ZONE IN BETWEEN. IMPORTANTLY, WE WILL EMPLOY A COLD TRAP THERMAL DESORPTION TECHNIQUE, WHICH PROVIDES FOR SAMPLES OF PURE CLOOCL AND CL2 TO ENTER THE ABSORPTION CELLS, PROVIDING INTERFERENCE-FREE ABSORPTION SPECTRA OF CLOOCL AROUND THE PEAK ABSORPTION. WHILE THE CLOOCL CROSS SECTIONS OF HIGHEST ACCURACY WILL BE OBTAINED AT WAVELENGTHS BELOW ~280 NM, BY CORRECTING FOR CL2 USING THE TWO-ABSORPTION-CELL METHOD, CLOOCL CROSS SECTIONS CAN BE OBTAINED OUT TO ~400 NM, THE LIMIT OF OUR SPECTROMETER. AS PART OF THE CLOOCL CROSS SECTION STUDY, NEW REFERENCE UV CROSS SECTIONS OF CLO WILL BE OBTAINED, EXTENDING THE PUBLISHED WAVELENGTH RANGE. FOR THE CLOOCL EQUILIBRIUM CONSTANT STUDY, A SIMILAR SETUP TO THE CLOOCL CROSS SECTION STUDY WILL BE EMPLOYED. CLOOCL AND CLO SPECTRA WILL BE COLLECTED AS A FUNCTION OF TEMPERATURE IN ONE ABSORPTION CELL, AGAIN EMPLOYING THE COLD TRAP THERMAL DESORPTION METHOD AS PART OF THE CLOOCL SOURCE. CL2, THE ONLY INTERFERING ABSORBER, HAS NO IMPACT ON THE RESULTS BECAUSE WE RELY ONLY ON ABSORPTIONS AT SHORTER WAVELENGTHS WHERE THE CL2 CROSS SECTION IS NEGLIGIBLE. IN SUMMARY, WE INTEND TO MEET THE EXPLICIT CALL FROM THE JPL EVALUATION FOR FURTHER STUDY OF THE UV CROSS SECTIONS OF CLOOCL ESPECIALLY AT THE PEAK, USING A NEW EXPERIMENTAL METHOD TO ENHANCE CLOOCL PURITY AND DETERMINE ITS CONCENTRATION. NEW UV CROSS SECTIONS OF CLO WILL BE OBTAINED AND THE EQUILIBRIUM CONSTANT OF CLOOCL WILL BE DETERMINED AS A FUNCTION OF TEMPERATURE WITH IMPROVED ACCURACY. THE ANDERSON GROUP IS WELL-SUITED TO PERFORM THESE STUDIES HAVING EXTENSIVE EXPERIENCE WITH CLOOCL AND CLO LABORATORY AND AIRCRAFT MEASUREMENTS.
doc.MajorAgency: UV ABSORPTION CROSS SECTIONS AND EQUILIBRIUM CONST
doc.MajorFundingAgency: UV ABSORPTION CROSS SECTIONS AND EQUILIBRIUM CONST

doc.ContractDescription: SPN-43 ROTARY COUPLERS ''IGF::OT::IGF''
IGF::OT::IGF EXERCISE OPTION I AFRL/RQ AEROSPACE SYSTEMS MARKETING SERVICES
24-WELL EXTRACELLULAR ANALYZER
COST PER TEST

IGF::OT::IGF FUTURE SATELLITE SYSTEMS AND INTERPLANETARY MISSIONS ARE PROJECTED TO REQUIRE POWER ELECTRONICS AND ENERGY STORAGE SYSTEMS THAT ARE LESS MASSIVE AND SMALLER THAN THE CURRENT STATE OF THE ART. MODERN CUBESATS RELY HEAVILY ON SOLAR PANELS TO PROVIDE THE NECESSARY ENERGY FOR OPERATION. ADDITIONALLY, RADIOISOTOPE THERMOELECTRIC GENERATORS (RTGS) ARE THE PRIMARY SOURCE OF ENERGY RESPONSIBLE FOR SUPPORTING LONG DURATION MISSIONS WHERE OTHER SOURCES OF ENERGY ARE NOT AVAILABLE OR ARE LOGISTICALLY PROHIBITIVE TO UTILIZE. IN BOTH CASES, TO SATISFY THE ELECTRICAL REQUIREMENTS OF HIGHER POWERED LOADS LI-ION BATTERY SOLUTIONS MUST INCREASE IN BOTH WEIGHT AND SIZE. FASTCAP SYSTEMS IS PROPOSING AN ULTRACAPACITOR BASED HYBRID POWER SUPPLY (HPS) TO DRAMATICALLY REDUCE THE SIZE AND WEIGHT OF CONVENTIONAL HIGH POWER ENERGY STORAGE SOLUTIONS WHILE INCREASING POWER HANDLING CAPABILITY. THE PROPOSED SYSTEM WILL INCORPORATE FASTCAPS PATENTED TECHNOLOGY FOR HARSH ENVIRONMENT AND RUGGEDIZED ULTRACAPACITORS ALREADY PROVEN IN THE OIL AND GAS INDUSTRY AND CURRENTLY BEING DEVELOPED ACROSS MULTIPLE GRANTS FOR SPACE EXPLORATION. THE TARGETED APPLICATION THAT THIS PROPOSAL WILL FOCUS ON IS A HIGH POWER (>100W) HPS FOR INTEGRATION INTO CUBESATS. ULTRACAPACITORS HAVE A RELATIVELY HIGH POWER DENSITY THAT IS ROUGHLY 10 TO 100 TIMES GREATER THAN LI-ION BATTERIES AND CAN BE INTEGRATED INTO AN ENERGY STORAGE SYSTEM TO BOTH INCREASE POWER HANDLING CAPABILITY AND REDUCE THE WEIGHT AND SIZE OF A SYSTEM DESIGNED FOR LI-ION BATTERIES ALONE. THE HPS WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR CHARGING AND MANAGING ITS ULTRACAPACITOR BANKS AS WELL AS PERFORMING SYSTEM DIAGNOSTICS THAT CAN BE REPORTED THROUGH THE UNITS COMMUNICATION PORT. THE SYSTEM WILL EMBRACE MODULAR DESIGN TECHNIQUES SIMILAR TO THOSE ALREADY EMPLOYED BY FASTCAPS ENERGY EXPLORATION SYSTEMS AND CONSIST OF TWO MODULES.
